Commentary.ab: The recitation of the three verses Y33.10c, Y36.6b or Y43.7a, as edited by Geldner, happens only in the ceremonies with the šnūman of Nōg-nāwar or Sīrōzag. In the rest of ceremonies, only one verse is recited, depnding on the gāh (Y33.10c for ušahina and hāuuani; Y36.6b for rapiθβina and Y43.7a for uzaiieirina (see the nērangs and N29.6).

Nerangs.ab: vohū uxšiiā manaŋhā xšaϑrā aṣ̌ācā uštā tanūm harw gāh dārēd sē bār guftan ud ka yašt nōgnāwar ayāb sih rōzag harw sē gāh ī nēmrōz ud aybārag guftan harw ēk sē bār ud ka gāh ī rapihwin bēd imā raōcā̊ barəzištəm barəzimanąm sē bār guftan ka gāh ī uzerin bēd yaɱī spəṇtā ϑβā maińiiū uruuaēsē jasō sē bār guftan

"vohū uxšiiā manaŋhā xšaϑrā aṣ̌ācā uštā tanūm He should say three times the text of the corresponding gāh. When it is a yašt Nōgnāwar or Sih-rōzag, then the three gāh, the one of Bāmzayd, the one of noon and the one of aybārag(?) have to be recited, each one three times. When it is the gāh rapihwin, he should say three times imā raōcā̊ barəzištəm barəzimanąm. When it is the gāh uzerin, he should recite three times yaɱī spəṇtā ϑβā maińiiū uruuaēsē jasō."

Quotations.ab: nōg-nāwar yašt-ē bowandagtar be kunišn u-š bowandagīh vohū uxšiiā manaŋhā imā̊ raocā̊ barəzištəm barəzimanąm ud ẏahmī spəṇtā θβā mainiiū uruuaēsē jasō har ēk 3 bār be gōwišn

The Yašt Nōg Nāwar has to be performed more complete. Its completness consists of reciting threetimes each of one of theses texts: vohū uxšiiā manaŋhā (Y33.10c), imā̊ raocā̊ barəzištəm barəzimanąm (Y36.6b) and ẏahmī spəṇtā θβā mainiiū uruuaēsē jasō(Y43.7a) .
